explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: The ignition points is 371 degC, and it is thought that it does not ignite in room temperatures.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: No data available on corrosion to metals

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Mean 1088 mg/kg was obtained from five data (ACGIH (2001), DFGOT vol.3 (1991), RTECS (2005), IUCLID (2000)) covering rat oral LD50: 951 to 1410 mg/kg. Since it was in the range of 300 to 2000 mg/kg, it was set as Category 4.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: There are rabbit dermal absorption acute LD50s = 1770mg/kg 8ACGIH (2001) and 1692mg/kg (DFGOT vol.3 (1991)). All were in the range of 1000 - 2000 mg/kg, it was set as Category 4.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: There is no data of LC50 with steam inhalation, and it cannot be classified. There is a rat lower fatality report of 50ppm/4H (ACGIH (2001)), and it is thought that toxicity is high.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: There was no 50% lethal dose data in mist inhalation. But there is information that 40% died within four days from inhalation exposure of mist 1.88mg/L for 4 hours (DFGOT vol.3 (1991)), and it is thought that LC50 goes into 1.0 - 5.0mg/L.. It was set as Category 4.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There is a report on human patch test that there was no irritation (IUCLID (2000)). But it was classified as Category 3 because there is a statement of "MILD" with skin application test on rabbits (RTECS (2005)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since there is the report of "MODERATE" in the administration test to the eyes of the rabbit, it was set as "Category 2A".

carcinogenicity.rationale: It gave a weak positive result in the in vivo study report (IUCLID (2000)). Although the in vitro results were described in ACGIH (2001), DFGOT vol.3 (1991), and IARC 57 (1993), that it gave negative for bacteria and it gave positive for mammals cultured cells. However, these articles did not state about the In vivo examination, and these have not carried out overall rating, either

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There is a report that the papillomatosis at the front stomach of male mouse and the growth of sarcoma at spleen of male rat were seen in the carcinogenesis bioassay which was carried out by NTP. It was judged with "2B" by Japanese industrial hygene academic Society acceptable limit recommendations for Hygiene and with "3" by the EU category. But IARC is set to "3" and ACGIH to "A4." According to the opinion of a specialist, it carried out "Category Outside."

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The bad influence to the newborn infant was not observed in two administration experiments to the pregnant female mouse (ACGIH (2001), DFGOT vol.3 (1991)). However, there is no test report about the reproductive potential of a male rat, and data is insufficient to make it the outside of category syntheticly.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (blood system, nervous system), Category 3 (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (blood system, nervous system) May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Symptoms accompanied by methemoglobin production are found in humans (ICSC (1998)) as well as in dogs and rats within the guidance value to Category 1 (ACGIH (2001), DFGOT vol.3 (1991)). In addition, asneuropathy and anesthetic actions are observed in humans (ICSC (1998), ACGIH (2001)). Therefore we classified it into "Category 1 (blood system, nervous system) and Category 3 (anesthetic action)."

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood, spleen, liver)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on that in repeated exposure experiments of rats with exposure-dose equivalent to the guidance value of Cattegory 1, the affect on blood (methemoglobinemia, anemia), a spleen, and liver (no detailed statements) is observed (ACGIH (2001), RTECS (2005), IUCLID (2000)), it was classified into "Category 1 (blood, spleen,liver)".

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48-hour EC50=5mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (IUCLID, 2000).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 2, since acute toxicity was Category 2 and not rapidly degrading (BOD: 1.9% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though less bio-accumulative (BCF=13.6 (existing chemical safety inspections data)).
